Are there documentation updates or do we need a JIRA task to capture it?
@amensiko you have some test code, right?
I copied some text from a news article (English) into the box but I didn't get any output when I clicked the `Detect` button. When I went back and clicked it again the sentences appeared as expected.

Thanks Jeff for trying it out. 
It might be slower to load as it is hosted on community cloud. Currently it is WIP so there are some approval pending on it. I will move to dedicated server as it get shape.
@kinow can you resolve the conflicts? Would be nice to get this merged.
Uhmm, how can this be optional? Execution time is now returned with regular output... Not good.
Right, it should print to System.err, do you want to open a jira and send a PR to fix it?
Close because #234 is a better approach.
We would need to have the code for that in our repository and also then find a place where we can host it.
I believe most issues were addressed, code rebase against master, tests passing. Ready to review again. Thanks!
+1, code change looks good, lets run the eval test before we merge it.
Thanks Joern. I've heard others mentioning the eval tests too... but I have no clue how to run them. Can I help and maybe run these yests?

I have developed it as OSS and published on github. You can review and suggest improvements

Please refer following repository links.
**Backend API's**        -  https://github.com/VisualAI/ai-backend
**Frontend Markup**  -  https://github.com/VisualAI/visualnlp
**Web Framework**    -  https://github.com/Appyfy/launcher

We can fork/copy it wherever needed. Also please share hosting details so that I can deploy the latest version there.

We would need to figure out how this project can host an online demo, maybe we could get help from AWS. What do you think about using something like AWS lambda to do the processing of the requests? 

Probably we need some kind of solution where a user can post a couple of sentences of text and then gets back a nice representation of all the things OpenNLP can detect.

Surely, **AWS Lamda** would be great place to host. I will work on it for next version. 
Currently I planned to create a JEE based **REST API's** that we can release to take initial reviews.

Also solution like detecting everything at once place will be good when a learner reach at later stage in documentation. It should serve as a **step by step guide** as user progress through various sections like
Sentence Detector
Tokenizor
POS Tagger etc.

Later, we can add support for online training of these tool and creating pipeline of it to create complex NLP workflows.
awesome thanks for adding the test, will review now

so I'm trying to test/integrate, but Apache DNS is messing up. One thing I did in my local (which I'll push when I merge) is that I removed the HT models - those shouldn't be part of the Apache project and can stay in USC IRDS repo. @amensiko

The commit to close this pull request <https://github.com/apache/opennlp/commit/b5b6d5c27443e1837b80b089206aad480852cd1c> has caused significant changes in the way sentences are detected by default.

Consider the input:

> hello.  
> how are
> you?  i am well.  i am 
> well.

Prior to this commit the input was counted as 4 sentences, after the commit it is counted as 6 sentences.

This doesn't seem like desired behavior to me.  Can someone explain if this is bug or what is going on?

Sorry, there was no consent on merging this. And there where several problems here with this PR:
- no single squashed and rebased commit (at least the way it was merged caused multiple merge commits)
- no consent about the interface for the component
- we are currently preparing the 1.8.1 release (and this can't be released in this state)
- this messed up our commit history (which can't be undone)

Please make a commit to undo the merge.
+1 from me! per discussion on this I will use Doc Cat and execute steps 1-3 from this thread https://s.apache.org/0mwM
merged
Merged.
Thanks for pointing that out, we need to fix this!
+1 lgtm
we can close this, will not be merged

Lets not merge this PR:
- We would need to host this on ASF infrastructure or something related to ASF
- We would need to have the code of the demo in this PR
- We need support for more components than the sentence detector
If this is the final commit, you need to fix commit message.
merging this...
I `@Ignore`d the individual tests to quickly make sure the verification worked. I un-ignored the tests and am running the full thing now just to be sure.
Tests failed due to out of memory exception in the UIMA tests ... we probably don't set -Xmx there which would make it work reliable.
What is preventing us from merging this?
+1 lgtm
This is merged now.

There is a mistake in the code. We need to know how many languages we have and skip (N * languages) samples instead. Or, we need to know the actual size of the resulting training dataset so we can skip exactly the number of lines. This will be harder if we train directly using the format instead of the converter.
If the skipping happens after shuffling it can't make sure that the categories are distributed evenly, but this should even out with higher counts.
Otherwise we would need to compute per file skip counts. Similar to how the counts are calculated for how many samples to read per file.
PR duplicated. Closing this one.
The commit message subject line should start with capital letter (e.g. like you write a title) and it should not be longer than 72 chars. Merged i anyway now for the next RC.

Hey, has the issue with newline characters being interpreted differently than before https://github.com/apache/opennlp/commit/b5b6d5c27443e1837b80b089206aad480852cd1c been fixed?  I haven't seen any discussion about it since the previous comment.
+1 seem like I missed that one... last time I looked at BILOU

If I execute mvn test after applying this patch, NameFinderMETest.testOnlyWithEntitiesWithTypes fails, because in this test, it uses "opennlp/tools/namefind/OnlyWithEntitiesWithTypes.train" training data and it looks like this:

```
<START:organization> NATO <END>
<START:location> United States <END>
<START:organization> NATO Parliamentary Assembly <END>
<START:location> Edinburgh <END>
<START:location> Britain <END>
<START:person> Anders Fogh Rasmussen <END>
<START:location> U . S . <END>
<START:person> Barack Obama <END>
<START:location> Afghanistan <END>
<START:person> Rasmussen <END>
<START:location> Afghanistan <END>
<START:date> 2010 <END>
```

But outcomes is produced like this:

```
organization-start
location-start
location-cont
organization-cont
person-start
person-cont
date-start
```

I think the above outcomes is not correct but this test has been passed previously.

Am I missing something?

Having a discussion with joern, I learned that we should consider outcomes as a set, not sequence. DFA cannot be applied to SequenceCodec.areOutcomesCompatible(), but it can be used the sequence validators.
I'll withdraw this.
Would it be useful for the annotation to have some sort of description, like `@Experimental("Look at OPENNLP-xxxx for details")`, or something like that?
@jzonthemtn yes, that would nice, but only makes sense if it makes it into the javadoc, do you know how to do that?
Question here is which module name we want to use.
That's a good point. And really anything that needs documented can just go into the javadocs for the function.
Right, you can just write the javadoc comment directly. Let me merge this.

The default is a reasonable value. The idea is that you can change this in case you have a use case of serializing and deserializing objects from different versions of OpenNLP. This is something our users really should not do.

And if they do it anyway, and we want to support that, we can by setting the version to indicate backward compatibility has been broken.

+1 to merge this, not sure we should maintain the stemmer code

#190 also deals with changes in the stemmer generated code. Regardless of whether this merged maybe we should make a list and submit pull requests to the stemmer generator. (Another is adding the `@Generated` annotation to the class.) Are there others?
The stemmer generated codes have been maintained manually in OPENNLP-952.

No,  please dont make the constructor private.   opennlp-tools is used as a library also.  If you make the TrainingParameters constructor private, you can ONLY create training parameters via a file.  Also a defaultTrainingParameters method uses this constructor.

Subject: Re: [apache/opennlp] OPENNLP-1150: TokenNameFinderTrainerTool should use ModelUtil.createD (#281)


@jzonthemtn commented on this pull request.

________________________________

In opennlp-tools/src/main/java/opennlp/tools/cmdline/namefind/TokenNameFinderTrainerTool.java<https://github.com/apache/opennlp/pull/281#discussion_r146236922>:

> @@ -115,7 +114,7 @@ public void run(String format, String[] args) {



     mlParams = CmdLineUtil.loadTrainingParameters(params.getParams(), true);

     if (mlParams == null) {

-      mlParams = new TrainingParameters();

Should the public constructor for TrainingParameters be made private?
